figure_1.title: Fig. 1.
figure_1.caption: Hospital-level factors affecting ICU admission for critically ill patients

claims.sentence: We identified four hospital-level factors influencing whether a patient might receive ICU care: (1) availability of ICU beds or alternative care locations; (2) availability, experience, comfort, and rapport of staff; (3) the hospital’s place in the hierarchy of interhospital transfer networks; and (4) hospital policies (actual and perceived) related to ICU admission (Fig. 1).

We identified four hospital-level factors influencing whether a patient might receive ICU care: (1) availability of ICU beds or alternative care locations; (2) availability, experience, comfort, and rapport of staff; (3) the hospital’s place in the hierarchy of interhospital transfer networks; and (4) hospital policies (actual and perceived) related to ICU admission (Fig. 1).

We identified four hospital-level factors influencing whether a patient might receive ICU care: (1) availability of ICU beds or alternative care locations; (2) availability, experience, comfort, and rapport of staff; (3) the hospital’s place in the hierarchy of interhospital transfer networks; and (4) hospital policies (actual and perceived) related to ICU admission (Fig. 1).
